hero.heading: Over 50 Years Supplying Piping Systems
hero.description: Atlas Plast is Iraq’s leading supplier in piping solutions, supplying quality PPR, PVC/uPVC, PP, and HDPE pipes. Now further expanding into ceramics, sanitary ware and heating
hero.trusted_text:
Trusted Partners Distributing 
 Atlas Quality Nationwide

piping_systems.title: Piping Systems
piping_systems.description: Atlas delivers complete water infrastructure solutions, including clean and sewage water systems, pumps, and heaters. We distribute high-quality PPR, PVC/UPVC, PP, and HDPE pipes designed to meet the diverse needs of sanitary, construction, and agricultural projects.

sanitary_ware.title: Sanitary Ware
sanitary_ware.description: Atlas supplies reliable sanitary ware built for durability, functionality, and modern appeal. Our range currently focuses on both Western and Eastern toilets, providing practical solutions that meet residential and commercial requirements.

ceramics.title: Ceramics
ceramics.description: Atlas offers a wide selection of ceramic tiles and finishes, from glazed ceramics to resilient porcelain. Our tiles combine strength, water resistance, and contemporary design, making them a trusted choice for stylish and long-lasting spaces.

about.label: Our Story
about.title: Pipes, Sanitary & Ceramics
about.description_1: For over half a century, Atlas has grown from a local supplier into Iraq's most respected provider of piping systems, sanitary ware, and ceramics. As the first company to introduce plastic pipes to the Iraqi market, Atlas pioneered a new era of modern, durable, and reliable piping solutions, setting the standard for quality and innovation in the industry.
about.description_2: Atlas imports products from leading manufacturers in Germany, Serbia, Saudi Arabia, Switzerland, Austria, and Turkey. Renowned for genuine, high-quality products, we supply agents with all the fittings and accessories needed for seamless pipe assembly and installation. With a network spanning all iraqi governorates and over 100 trusted active sellers across Iraq, Atlas stands on loyalty, trust, professionalism, and international expertise—building long-term partnerships and delivering consistent value nationwide.

aboutStyle4.label: From The Beginning
aboutStyle4.description_1: Atlas Plast traces its origins to 1975, when Engineer Abdul Amir Al-Moussawi began supplying foreign companies in Iraq’s booming construction sector. Despite the challenges of the 1990s, he founded Atlas Showroom in Baghdad’s Al-Shaab market, specializing in iron pipes and accessories. The showroom became a trusted distributor for the General Company for Trading Construction Materials and an important supplier for Baghdad Municipality projects.
aboutStyle4.description_2: The turning point came after 2003, when Atlas expanded under the name Atlas Plast, introducing international brands to Iraq and supplying major reconstruction projects. In 2004, a key partnership with Mr. Mahmoud Al-Jaf led to Masari Company securing the exclusive German Banninger agency, strengthening Atlas Plast’s reputation in the market.
aboutStyle4.description_3: During the difficult years of 2006–2007, the company relocated to Sulaymaniyah, managed by Engineer Jaafar Al-Moussawi, who partnered with Mr. Abdul Razzaq Al-Hayali to establish the Erbak Factory for PVC pipes. Despite its success, the factory closed in 2015 due to a lack of government support for local products.

aboutStyle5.description_1: From 2008 onwards, Atlas Plast returned to Baghdad with a stronger strategy. In 2009, it launched Ufuq Alatlas Company, followed by a branch in Erbil in 2010 and in Basra in 2012, ensuring full coverage of the Iraqi market. Strategic partnerships also flourished, including with Mr. Mohammed Jasib to establish Al-Ameer Sanitaryware Showroom, distributing Saudi brand Fabco.
aboutStyle5.description_2: In 2012, the company founded Qimam Atlas Company to expand its international collaborations. Later, in 2018, Atlas Plast partnered with Spark Company to open a Vitra agency branch in Baghdad’s Camp Sarah market. That same year, it developed advanced storage facilities in Baghdad covering 20,000 m², featuring modern machinery, solar lighting, and fire protection systems.
aboutStyle5.description_3: In 2019, Atlas Plast entered a landmark partnership with Turan Makina of Turkey, expanding into polyethylene products and infrastructure solutions.
aboutStyle5.description_4: Today, Atlas Plast stands as one of Iraq’s most trusted names in pipes, sanitaryware, and construction materials. With over four decades of experience, strategic partnerships, and modern infrastructure, the company continues to deliver global-quality solutions to Iraq’s growing markets.

brands.label: Brands
brands.title: Atlas Plast & Our Trusted Partners
brands.description_1: Atlas Plast has been a pioneer in Iraq's water and sanitary solutions since 1990. We distribute high-quality pipes, fittings, and sanitaryware, collaborating closely with top global manufacturers around the world to bring the best products to our customers.
brands.description_2: Our product range includes PPR, PPS, HDPE, and UPVC pipes, sanitaryware, and polyethylene products sourced from trusted global suppliers.
brands.description_3: Atlas Plast collaborates with leading German manufacturers such as +GF+ and WISA, ensuring that our customers receive high-quality, reliable, and innovative piping and sanitary solutions.
